summary: The HTTP API routes need to be configurable at a non-root subpath (e.g., /api) to avoid conflicts with UI client-side routes and to support use cases where UI Server is hosted at a subpath. Currently, API routes are set at the root level, which creates integration challenges.
userImpact: Users hosting UI Server at a subpath cannot properly integrate it with the API, and root-level API routes conflict with client-side UI routing.
rootCause: API routes were simplified to root level in #410, but this creates routing conflicts when UI and API are served together.
proposedFix: Make the API route path configurable and default to a non-root subpath like /api instead of root level.
keyQuote: The path for the API routes should be configurable. They should default to something (e.g. /api) and not be set at the root by default
